repetitions.sourceText: Administration of First and Subsequent Infusions of Atezolizumab/Placebo

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'If subject experiences AE requiring permanent treatment discontinuation', 'path': ['TREATMENT_DISCONTINUATION', 'SAFETY_FOLLOW_UP']}, {'condition': 'If subject consents to optional research', 'path': ['RESEARCH_BIOSAMPLE_REPOSITORY']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Obtained once from persons to whom the drug may be administered prior to study participation.
Samples are collected at multiple time points, though the amendment notes removal of the specific Follow-Up collection.
Triggered by signs or symptoms such as laboratory or cardiac imaging abnormalities; involves conditional management guidelines.
Conditional workflow based on the occurrence of reactions or cytokine-release syndrome (CRS) requiring specific grading and management.
Assessment of PD-L1 status for patients with previously untreated TNBC to determine eligibility/stratification.

footnoteConditions.text: a1. If a scheduled treatment visit cannot be completed due to a holiday, dosing may be postponed to the earliest next date; subsequent dosing should continue according to the original schedule.

footnoteConditions.text: a2. Assessments scheduled on the day of study treatment administration (Day 1) of each cycle should be performed prior to study treatment infusion unless otherwise noted.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: a2. Assessments scheduled on the day of study treatment administration (Day 1) of each cycle should

footnoteConditions.text: a3. Paclitaxel will be administered at the 90 mg/m2 dose via 1-hour IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15 of every 28-day cycle.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: a3. Paclitaxel will be administered at the 90 mg/m2 dose via 1-hour IV infusion on Days 1, 8, and 15

footnoteConditions.text: b. Patients will be asked to return to the clinic within 30 days after their last study drug dose for a treatment discontinuation visit.

footnoteConditions.text: c. Written informed consent is required before performing any study-specific tests or procedures.

footnoteConditions.text: d. Demographic information includes age, gender, and self-reported race/ethnicity.

footnoteConditions.text: e. All patients will be tested for HIV antibody, HBsAg, HBcAb, HBsAb, and hepatitis C virus antibody (HCVAb) locally, prior to the inclusion into the study.

footnoteConditions.text: l. Standard 12-lead ECG, taken after resting in a supine position for at least 10 minutes.

footnoteConditions.text: m. Haematology consists of RBC count, haemoglobin, haematocrit, WBC count with differential and platelet count. endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)

timeWindow.duration: Until first occurrence of progression or death

endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Statistically significant improvement in PFS based on stratified log-rank test (two-sided alpha 5%)
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Progression-free survival (PFS), defined as the time from randomisation to the first occurrence of disease progression, as determined by the investigator using RECIST v1.1, or death from any cause dur

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Overall Survival (OS)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Tested hierarchically after PFS; improvement in OS in PD-L1-positive and ITT populations
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: overall survival (OS) in the PD-L1-positive subpopulation; [4] OS in the ITT population

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Proportion of patients with objective response per RECIST v1.1
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: ORR by RECIST v1.1 in the PD-L1-positive, Response-evaluable subpopulation; [6] ORR by RECIST v1.1 in the ITT population.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Time to deterioration in Global Health Status
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Increase in time to deterioration compared to control arm
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Time to deterioration in Global Health Status

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Proportion of patients achieving clinical benefit

derivedVariables.name: Overall Survival
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Date of death from any cause minus date of randomization
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at date last known to be alive

derivedVariables.name: Time to deterioration in Global Health Status
sourceVariables: EORTC QLQ-C30 Global Health Status score
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from randomization to the first decrease in score of >= 10 points from baseline
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing assessment prior to first study drug administration
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at last valid PRO assessment

derivedVariables.name: Progression-Free Survival
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from randomization to the first occurrence of disease progression or death from any cause
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: From randomization until progression or death

derivedVariables.name: Objective Response Rate
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Percentage of patients with a best overall response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Presence of measurable disease at baseline
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Patients without post-baseline assessment are considered non-responders

derivedVariables.name: Duration of Objective Response
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from first occurrence of CR or PR until disease progression or death
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: From first response until progression or death

derivedVariables.name: Clinical Benefit Rate
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Percentage of patients with CR, PR, or Stable Disease (SD) lasting >= 6 months
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Presence of measurable or non-measurable disease at baseline

derivedVariables.name: Changes from Baseline in Patient Function and Symptoms
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing assessment prior to first study drug administration
